intro: Verticordia rennieana, commonly known as the Red-stemmed Featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in heathland and sandplain environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
